item.title: A Primer on Data Normalization
item.description: Normalizing data is a common data engineering task. It prepares information to be stored in a way that minimizes duplication and is digestible by machines.Â  It also aims to solve other problems and issues that are out of scope for this particular article but worth reading about if you find yourself struggling to understand jokes about E. F. Codd. This begs the question, why does normalization matter when entering information in a table or organizing a spreadsheet? In order to properly answer that question, we should explore a simple example.
